cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 530 miles ESE of Port O'Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest across the north-western Gulf toward the central Texas coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast (between Port Mansfield and High Island, near Port O'Connor)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Port Mansfield to High Island, Texas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Much of the Texas coast and adjacent Louisiana coast within the north-western Gulf of Mexico
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with a low (≤10%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts possible late Friday into Saturday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation and dangerous rip currents expected; heights generally below 3 ft on the Upper Texas coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain with isolated totals near 6 inches possible Friday–Saturday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and rip currents beginning within 24–36 h of advisory time.
